intro: Actinomeris alata, commonly known as the winged fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are divided into four lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its reproductive structures include small, yellowish flowers that develop into buoyant, spore-bearing fruits. Actinomeris alata plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small fish.
